thread.title: UMass vs. Bowling Green: Minutemen open as two-touchdown road underdogs in MAC opener
thread.title_full: UMass vs. Bowling Green: Minutemen open as two-touchdown road underdogs in MAC opener

author: Daniel Malone | Special to MassLive
title: UMass vs. Bowling Green: Minutemen open as two-touchdown road underdogs in MAC opener
text:
Comments 
The University of Massachusetts football team finally has that elusive first win under its belt, but that doesn't mean life will get any easier for the Minutemen this week. 
According to betting website VegasInsider.com , the Minutemen opened this week as a 14-point road underdog in their Mid-American Conference opener at Bowling Green. 
The line has since dropped to 13.5. That's still a lot of points. 
Bowling Green comes into the game 3-2 after a 28-22 win at Buffalo. UMass has never beaten the Falcons, falling 47-42, 28-7 and 24-0 over the past three years. 
UMass is 2-2 against the spread this season after Saturday's 24-14 win over Florida International. 
For the Minutemen, this game is the most important they'll face in league play. As back-to-back MAC East champions, the road to Detroit goes through BG. The Falcons were picked to three-peat in the division during the preseason, and their play has lived up to those expectations so far, netting the team road victories at Maryland (48-27) and Purdue (35-28) another near-win against Memphis. 
Saturday's game kicks off at Doyt Perry Stadium in Ohio at 2 p.m. and will be broadcast online via ESPN3/WatchESPN. 
Follow MassLive.com UMass beat writer @Daniel_Malone on Twitter or reach him via email .
